edu.ucla.sspace.clustering
Class ClusteringByCommittee

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee
All Implemented Interfaces:
Clustering
public class ClusteringByCommittee
extends Object
implements Clustering

An implementation of the Clustering by Committee (CBC) algorithm. This implementation is based on the Pantel's thesis:

  • Patrick Pantel. 2003. Clustering by Committee. Ph.D. Dissertation. Department of Computing Science, University of Alberta, Canada. available here.

This class offers five parameters for configuring how the clustering occurs

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.averageLinkMergeThreshold"
Default: ".25"
The property to specify during the Phase II.1 when to stop the agglomerative clustering of the nearest neighbors. This property specifies a double threshold where clusters whose the average-link similarity falls below the value will not be merged (i.e. stay two clusters).

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.maxCommitteeSimilarity"
Default: ".35"
The property to specify during Phase II.3 what is the maximum similarity between two committees above which a new committee will not be included. This property corresponds to θ-1 in the CBC papers. This property specifies a double.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.residueSimilarityThreshold"
Default: ".25"
The property for specifying the similarity threshold in Phase II.5 where if an element has a similarity less than this threshold to all existing committees, the element is marked as "residue" and recursively clustered. This property corresponds to the θ-2 parameter in the original papers. The property is specified as a double.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.useHardClustering"
Default: true
Specifies whether CBC should use a hard (single class) or soft (multi-class) cluster labeling. The default behavior is to use hard clustering.

Property: "edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.softClusteringThreshold"
Default: ".25"
If soft clustering is enabled, specifies a double the threshold used during soft clustering where a point will not be labeled with the committees who are more similar than this value. If hard clustering is enabled the value of this property has no effect. See Phrase III of the CBC algorithm for more details.

This class is thread-safe.

Author:
David Jurgens

Method Detail

cluster

public Assignments cluster(Matrix m,
                           int numClusters,
                           Properties props)
Ignores the provided number of clusters and clusters the rows of the provided matrix using the CBC algorithm. This method is equivalent to calling cluster(Matrix,Properties) without specifying the number of clusters.

Specified by:
cluster in interface Clustering
Parameters:
m - the Matrix whose row data points are to be clustered
numClusters - the number of clusters to generate
props - the properties to use for any parameters each clustering algorithm may need
Returns:
an array of Assignment instances that indicate zero or more clusters to which each row belongs.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if m is not an instance of SparseMatrix.

cluster

public Assignments cluster(Matrix m,
                           Properties props)
Clusters the rows of m according to the CBC algorithm, using props to specify the configurable parameters of the algorithm.

Specified by:
cluster in interface Clustering
Parameters:
m - the Matrix whose row data points are to be clustered
props - the properties to use for any parameters each clustering algorithm may need
Returns:
an array of Assignment instances that indicate zero or more clusters to which each row belongs.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if m is not an instance of SparseMatrix.

buildCommitteesForRow

public static List<edu.ucla.sspace.clustering.ClusteringByCommittee.CandidateCommittee> buildCommitteesForRow(Collection<Integer> rows,
                                                                                                              SparseMatrix sm,
                                                                                                              double avgLinkMergeThresh)
Builds a set of candidate committees from the clusters formed by the average-link clustering of the provided rows.

Parameters:
avgLinkMergThresh - the parameter used by HAC to determine when to stop merging clusters on the basis of their dissimilarity
